contentrichtext.text: [[File:ESTRACK New Norcia gnangarra.jpg|thumb|ESTRACK antenna undergoing repairs/maintenance]] '''New Norcia Station''' is a 35-metre [[ESTRACK]] [[radio]] [[Antenna (electronics)|antenna]] for communication with [[spacecraft]] in deep space. It is located {{convert|10|km|mi}} south of the town of [[New Norcia]], [[Western Australia]]. It was built for the [[European Space Agency]]. The station was officially opened on 5 March 2003 by the Premier of Western Australia at the time, Dr [[Geoffrey Gallop|Geoff Gallop]]. The New Norcia antenna has an almost identical sister station, [[Cebreros Station]], near [[Madrid]], Spain. A third similar station, [[MalargÃ¼e Station]], is under construction in Argentina, and will provide 360 degree coverage for deep space missions when completed. ==External links== * [http://www.esa.int/SPECIALS/Operations/SEM8YCSMTWE_0.html ESA webpage on ESTRACK, including links to all stations] * [http://www.esa.int/SPECIALS/Operations/SEMGSDSMTWE_0.html ESA/ESTRACK New Norcia station page] {{coord|-31.0482|116.1914|type:landmark_region:AU|display=title}} [[Category:Infrastructure completed in 2003]] [[Category:Buildings and structures in Western Australia]] [[Category:Science and technology in Western Australia]] [[Category:Earth stations in Australia]] [[Category:European Space Agency]] {{Australia-struct-stub}} {{space-stub}} {{WesternAustralia-stub}}
